edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse

Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.thehouse.UserInterface

  • public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class basically serves to print all information to the command prompt. It will take input from the user in specific circumstances, but for the most part is called from GameEngine.
    Author:
    Ben Nickerson, Andrew Niklas, Andrew Nipp

    • Field Detail

      • userChoice

        private java.lang.String userChoice
        This field holds the choice of the user. There are 7 potential values for the user to select: left, right, up, down, shoot, save, exit

      • input

        private java.lang.String input
        This field holds the input from the user.

      • sc

        private java.util.Scanner sc
        This field instantiates the Scanner

    • Method Detail

      • rules

        public void rules()
        This method is called by mainMenu().

      • mainMenu

        public void mainMenu()
        This method will print the main menu of the game to the user and give options such as, "continue" or "new game".

      • options

        public void options()
        This method simply prints out all potential options for the User to choose from during the game's runtime. "Debug Mode" will show all objects on the grid and give the user infinite ammo; "Save" will save the game's state. "New Game" will reset the game's state. "Mute the music" will end the sound byte for the background music, if the music is already off it will start again.

      • printGrid

        public void printGrid(Grid grid)
        This method prints the Grid in its current state. This will occur after every round. It will pull the Grid class from the param and then call Grid.printGrid()
        Parameters:
        grid -

      • turnSelect1

        public void turnSelect1()
        This method simply prints out all possible actions the User can make during runtime. Primarily, the actions that will affect the game state are "Look", "Move", and "Shoot". Selecting options will call options(). Selecting exit will end the program.

      • turnSelect2

        public void turnSelect2()
        This method simply prints out all possible actions the User can make during runtime; specifically after they select the "Look" function. Primarily, the actions that will affect the game state are "Move" and "Shoot". Selecting options will call options(). Selecting exit will end the program.

      • setChoice

        public void setChoice(java.lang.String choice)
        This method will set the userChoice to whatever String is passed to it.
        Parameters:
        choice - - String containing some value intended for userChoice.

      • getChoice

        public java.lang.String getChoice()
        This method will pass userChoice to whatever calls it.
        Returns:

        This method simply prints out the four cardinal directions that the user can move.

        This method exists to force the user to hit Enter before the next line is called.

      • newGame

        public boolean newGame()
        This method exists to determine whether or not a new game will be created.
        Returns:
        Boolean answer - true if the user selects yes, false if the user selects no

      • playerDies

        public void playerDies()
        This method prints when the Player is murdered by an Enemy

      • foundBriefcase

        public void foundBriefcase()
        This method prints when the Player finds the bomb

      • printStats

        public void printStats(Player ply,
                       boolean hasRadar,
                       int m)
        This method prints out information pertinent to the game state. Such as: how much ammo the player has and whether they have a shield activated.
        Parameters:
        ply - - Player object
        hasRadar - - boolean true when Player has radar, false otherwise.
        m - - int containing the amount of turns left for Shield.

      • congrats

        public void congrats()
        This method prints whenever the Player wins

      • missionFailed

        public void missionFailed()
        This method prints whenever the Player loses.
